title: Cannes 2023: Wang Bing captures the unseen realities of the Chinese way of life
description: With 'Youth (Spring),' the Chinese filmmaker documents his country's society by following the daily life of young textile workers in the Shanghai region.

title: Italy: Violent floods displace more than 36,000 people
description: Six months' worth of rain fell in 36 hours in the northeast Emilia-Romagna region, with the floods described as the worst the country has seen in a century.

title: Martin Amis, acclaimed British novelist, dies at 73
description: Martin, best known for his works works 'Money' and 'London Fields', rose to literary celebrity amid the hip 1980s British fiction boom. He passed away on Friday in his home in Florida.

title: Hollywood royalty flood Cannes for 'Killers of the Flower Moon' premiere
description: The three-and-a-half-hour movie, which was funded by Apple, is showing out of competition.

title: Man City wins English Premier League after Arsenal loses at Nottingham Forest
description: It is City's seventh league crown in 12 years for the Abu Dhabi-owned club.

title: The twelfth-tier football club saved by migrants
description: In the summer of 2022, the sports club in the village of Argy, in central France, was about to shut down. Then a 'miracle' happened: 15 migrants came knocking, looking to join a team. Seven nationalities are now represented at US Argy.

title: Is white wine cheese's new best friend?
description: A red wine, especially if it is a tannic one, is never the best option for a cheese board. It is better to go for a white wine. Its floral, mineral or spicy notes have a better chance of marrying with the diversity of cooked, soft and blue-veined pressed cheeses.

title: La Rochelle beat Leinster 27-26 to retain rugby Champions Cup
description: The Irish province ended the match with 14 men after Michael Ala'alatoa's late red card.

title: Sudan: Air strikes shake Khartoum, Qatari embassy attacked
description: Air strikes and artillery exchanges shook the Sudanese capital on May 20, while armed men ransacked the Qatari embassy.

title: Women's World Cup still without broadcaster, 60 days before competition
description: Discussions between FIFA and several European television channels remain at a standstill two months before the event, scheduled from July 20 to August 20 in Oceania.

title: US Supreme Court's decision over Warhol copyright case troubles the art world
description: The Andy Warhol Foundation lost a copyright case against Lynn Goldsmith, a photographer whose photo of Prince was used by the American artist.

title: Social diversity in schools, France's unfinished project
description: The plan presented by the French education minister turns out to be less ambitious than predicted, even though solving this issue would benefit us all.

title: A flyposting campaign featuring Macron as Hitler ignites controversy in Avignon
description: About 30 posters reproducing the anti-Macron mural of a local graffiti artist, erased a few weeks ago, were posted in the Southeastern French city, during the night of May 17.

title: Wagner claims complete control of Bakhmut, Ukraine says situation 'critical'
description: The head of Russia's Wagner mercenary group on Saturday claimed the complete capture of the city. Ukraine said it still retained some ground control.

title: G7 urges China to press Russia to end war in Ukraine
description: China on Saturday expressed 'strong dissatisfaction' with the joint statement issued by G7 leaders.

title: France hopes US will step-up cooperation on terror threats ahead of Paris Olympics
description: On a visit to Washington and New York, French Interior Minister Gérald Darmanin said that Islamist terrorism was Europe's greatest threat.

title: Fresh protests against violence take place in Serbia
description: Tens of thousands of people rallied in Belgrade for the third time in a month in protest against the government after two mass shootings that occurred earlier this month.

title: Nebraska passes 12-week abortion ban, restrictions on gender-affirming care for minors
description: In a contentious move, lawmakers in the midwestern US state voted on May 19 to limit access to abortion and restrict gender-affirming care for people younger than 19.

title: At Off-White, Ibrahim Kamara has the makings of a designer
description: The 33-year-old Sierra Leone-born designer has the tough task of replacing artistic director Virgil Abloh, who died in 2021. It has been a lightning-fast rise for this workaholic who led his first fashion show in March.

title: Arab League Summit: Assad overshadowed by Zelensky
description: The presence of the Ukrainian president, imposed by Saudi Arabia, was not to the taste of all the leaders at the summit, many of whom are close to Russia.

title: Britney Griner returns to WNBA
description: Griner was arrested on drug charges at a Moscow airport in February 2022. She was eventually released as part of a prisoner swap in December.

title: Cannes 2023: The real business takes place off the red carpet
description: Alongside the film festival, the industry's movers and shakers take over the Palais des Festivals for the all-important film market, where they sell their films to foreign distributors.

title: War in Ukraine: Biden's shift brings prospect of F-16s closer despite long road ahead
description: At the G7 summit in Japan, Joe Biden lifted his veto on the supply of these American aircraft to Kyiv by its allies. But few countries are able to deliver them quickly.

title: Can the Russian air force still change the course of the war in Ukraine?
description: Russian aerospace forces are equipped with a large number of aircraft. But they suffer from shortcomings that limit their destructive potential when confronting Kyiv's counteroffensive.

title: Three Russian scientists who worked on hypersonic weapons arrested for high treason
description: Colleagues of the arrested scientists have condemned their incarceration in a letter published on May 15.

title: Zelensky arrives in Hiroshima for G7 talks as world leaders sanction Russia
description: Bolstering international support is a key priority for Ukraine as it prepares for a major push intended to take back territory seized by Russia.

title: Tourism returns to Jordan
description: The first quarter of 2023 has confirmed the recovery in the Middle Eastern country that began last year, easing an economy weakened by the Covid-19 pandemic.

title: A new generation of African filmmakers holds sway at Cannes
description: Two directors are competing for the top Palme d'Or prize, while four other filmmakers are competing in the 'Un certain regard' section.

title: Rabies scourge continues to grow in India
description: The country is estimated to have between 30 and 60 million stray dogs, which are the main vectors of transmission of the disease, killing 21,000 people per year.

title: In Hungary, the reality of immigration lies behind hostile propaganda
description: Although Viktor Orban likes to portray himself as the defender of the Magyars at risk of 'migratory submersion,' his country does need foreign labor and is increasingly calling on it.
